result.name: benefit-claimants-in-cambridgeshire-and-peterborough1
result.notes:
Datasets of Lower Super Output Areas of Cambridgeshire and Peterborough detailing claimant counts of benefits for every month between Feb '00 - Feb '15

Employment and Support Allowance (ESA) replaced Incapacity Benefit and Income Support paid on the grounds of incapacity for new claims from 27th October 2008. It is paid to people who are incapable of work and who meet certain contribution conditions.

Jobseeker's Allowance is a benefit payable to unemployed people. In general, to be entitled to claim a person must be available for work, be actively seeking work, and have entered into a Jobseeker's Agreement with Jobcentre Plus.

Income support is a non-contributory benefit paid to people who have low incomes and who are not required to be available for employment. The main types of people receiving IS are pensioners, lone parents, the long and short-term sick, people with disabilities and other special groups.

Attendance Allowance In December 2015, an additional two files were added to show the number of Attendance Allowance claims made as at May 2015, based on a DWP data query.

organization.name: cambridgeshire-insight
organization.title: Cambridgeshire Insight
organization.description: The Cambridgeshire Insight Partnership is made up of public, health and community bodies to provide a shared research knowledge base for the Cambridgeshire area. It allows users an easy way to access and share data, information and research for deeper insights about their local area. See more at https://cambridgeshireinsight.org.uk

result.title: Benefit Claimants in Cambridgeshire and Peterborough

resources.description:
csv file of benefit claimants - employment and support allowance for small areas (LSOA) for Cambridgeshire and Peterborough.

Incapacity Benefit (IB) is paid to people who are incapable of work and who meet certain contribution conditions. Employment and Support Allowance (ESA) replaced Incapacity Benefit and Income Support paid on the grounds of incapacity for new claims from 27th October 2008.
resources.name: benefit claimants - employment and support allowance for small areas

resources.description:
csv file of benefit claimants - income support for small areas (LSOA) for Cambridgeshire and Peterborough.

Income support is a non-contributory benefit paid to people who have low incomes and who are not required to be available for employment. The main types of people receiving IS are pensioners, lone parents, the long and short-term sick, people with disabilities and other special groups.
resources.name: benefit claimants - income support for small areas

resources.description:
csv file of benefit claimants - job seekers allowance for small areas (LSOA) for Cambridgeshire and Peterborough, February 2000-February 2015.

Jobseeker's Allowance is a benefit payable to unemployed people. In general, to be entitled to claim a person must be available for work, be actively seeking work, and have entered into a Jobseeker's Agreement with Jobcentre Plus.
resources.name: benefit claimants - job seekers allowance for small areas

resources.description:
A dataset showing number of attendance allowance claims in each lower super output area (LSOA) as at May 2015, across Cambridgeshire, West Suffolk and Peterborough.
The data comes from a query using Department of Work and Pensions data, through a tool called (xxx). This provided national data on attendance allowance claims which has been edited to show only the LSOAs in Cambridge, East Cambridgeshire, Fenland, Forest Heath, Huntingdonshire, Peterborough, South Cambridgeshire and St Edmundsbury, with ONS codes added to assist in comparing the data. It is published here in both csv and excel formats.
resources.name: Attendance Allowance claims at May 2015
